description: Let q_k=p(p+2) be product of k-th pair of twin primes; sequence gives values of p such that (q_k)^2 > q_{k-i}q_{k+i} for all 1 <= i <= k-1.
links: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
prog: (PARI) twins=List(); p=3;forprime(q=5,1e5,if(q-p==2,listput(twins,q)); p=q); for(k=1,(#twins+1)\2, for(i=1,k-1,if(twins[k]^2 < twins[k-i]*twins[k+i],next(2))); print1(twins[k]-2", ")) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 02 2014
author: _Naohiro Nomoto_
extensions: a(1) inserted by _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 02 2014
